intro: Verticordia endlicheriana var. compacta, commonly known as the compact verticordia, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive, urn-shaped flowers. The plant typically produces vibrant red or orange flowers during the summer months, which attract various pollinators. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, contributing to its ornamental value in gardens. This variety is well-suited to dry conditions and thrives in well-drained soils.
